articles.author: Shrijith Venkatramana
articles.description:
Hi there! I'm Shrijith Venkatrama, founder of Hexmos. Right now, I‚Äôm building LiveAPI, a first of its kind tool for helping you automatically index API endpoints across all your repositories. LiveAPI helps you discover, understand and use APIs in large tech infrastructures with ease.
The web runs on HTTPS, and getting certificates used to be a manual, error-prone mess. Enter the ACME protocol, a game-changer that automates certificate issuance and renewal. If you‚Äôve ever set up Let‚Äôs Encrypt or wondered how servers magically keep their HTTPS certificates fresh, this is the tech behind it. In this post, we‚Äôll break down how ACME works, why it matters, and how you can use it. Expect practical examples, code, and enough detail to make you dangerous (in a good way).
ACME (Automatic Certificate‚Ä¶
articles.title: How The ACME Protocol Automates HTTP Security

articles.author: Mikuz
articles.description:
In today‚Äôs healthcare landscape, cybersecurity is not just about compliance‚Äîit‚Äôs about patient safety. The complexity of electronic health records (EHR), interconnected medical devices, and hybrid IT environments has made healthcare an attractive target for cybercriminals. That‚Äôs why adopting privileged access management best practices is no longer optional for healthcare organizations aiming to secure sensitive patient data and operational integrity.
Modern healthcare institutions must evolve their access strategies to safeguard privileged accounts used by IT admins, doctors, third-party vendors, and even automated systems. Mismanagement or compromise of these accounts can result in HIPAA violations, massive data breaches, and serious disruptions in clinical care.
Privileged accounts in h‚Ä¶
articles.title: Privileged Access Management Best Practices in Healthcare IT Systems

(Editorial note: I originally wrote this post over on the Hit Subscribe blog.  I‚Äôll be cross-posting anything I think this audience might find interesting and also started a SubStack to which I‚Äôll syndicate marketing-related content.)
I know, it's been a while.¬† For anyone wondering if I'd given up the blogging habit, I haven't.¬† I just forgot how to read for a bit.
Luckily, however, I have a 4-year-old that loves Dr Seuss, so that's gotten me back on track and no worse for the wear, except for my new penchant to follow people around like an absolute maniac, trying to get them to eat eggs and ham.
Instead of returning to form with one of the many productive tutorials I have in mind, today I rant.¬† But I think it will be productive and even help some of you reading.
I'm going to do a deep-d‚Ä¶

articles.author: lihil
articles.description:
I built a fullstack solopreneur project template with free cloud hosting and detailed tutorials
Hey everyone,
What‚Äôs in it:
Detailed Tutorials & config template to eploy backend to Vercel and frontend to Cloudflare (both have free tiers)
Supabase for database and auth (also free tier)
Generate frontend client based on backend API
Dashboard with metrics and analytics
User management and role-based access control
Sign up / sign in with OAuth
Task management with full CRUD
Pre-configured dev setup with Docker and hot reload
Login & Signup

Task management

User management

it‚Äôs meant to be used as a quick project starter for app developed by a single person, It followed solid backend/frontend practices, used modern tools (React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind, OpenAPI, etc.), and tried to keep the architecture clean and easy to extend.
If you‚Äôre looking to learn how to actually build and deploy a real app with no cost, this could help. Whether you‚Äôre making a SaaS, a side project, or just want to understand the fullstack flow better, I hope this saves you some time.
Still actively improving it, so any feedback is appreciated.
Frontend is based on this great project called shadcn-admin (https://github.com/satnaing/shadcn-admin)
GITHUB


github-fullstack-solopreneur-template
articles.title: I Created a Fullstack template to let you deploy your app on cloud for 0 cost

articles.author: Ssewannonda Keith Edwin
articles.description:
Introduction


In the world of web development, performance is king. Fast-loading applications keep users happy, reduce server load, and improve overall user experience. One of the most effective ways to achieve this is through intelligent caching. When a client requests data that hasn't changed since their last request, wouldn't it be great if we could just tell them "you already have this"? That's exactly what the HTTP 304 Not Modified status code is for.
However, implementing 304 Not Modified effectively can be tricky, especially when in the real world data lives in a database. How do you efficiently determine if the data has truly changed without re-fetching and re-processing everything? This is where Delta comes in. As SimonCropp says 
Delta is an approach to implementing a 304 Not Mo‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Delta Difference: Unleashing .NET, EF Core, and PostgreSQL Performance with Delta

articles.author: Manognya Lokesh Reddy
articles.description:
Hi Dev Community! üëã
I‚Äôm Manognya Lokesh Reddy, and I love building practical AI tools that solve real-world problems. Today, I want to share a project that‚Äôs especially close to me‚ÄîDocuDetective.AI, an AI-powered chatbot I built that lets users interact with PDF documents using natural language.
If you‚Äôve ever struggled to find specific info in a 100+ page document, you‚Äôll love this.
ü§î The Problem
You‚Äôre looking for specific information fast.
The document is in a language you don‚Äôt understand.
You want a summary instead of reading the whole thing.
DocuDetective.AI was built to solve all of this.
üß† Project Goals
Ask questions like ‚ÄúWhat is the main conclusion?‚Äù or ‚ÄúTranslate this section.‚Äù
Support vernacular language translation.
Use AI to chat with the document in real-time.
üõ†Ô∏è Tech Stack
LangChain ‚Äì for chaining LLMs with document loaders and memory
Chroma DB ‚Äì for vector embeddings and document retrieval
OpenAI GPT models ‚Äì for natural language understanding
Streamlit (optional) ‚Äì for a user-friendly interface
‚öôÔ∏è How It Works
Vector Storage
Query Handling
Response Generation
üìä Results & Impact
üí¨ Increased user engagement by 35% through interactive Q&A instead of static search.
üåç Helped bridge language gaps for users working with multilingual documents.
üí° What I Learned
Preprocessing and chunking documents is a balancing act. Too much or too little = bad results.
Users prefer conversation over command lines‚Äîgood UX really matters.
articles.title: üìÑ How I Built DocuDetective.AI: A Chatbot for Interactive PDF Analysis

articles.author: Omar Urbano | LightningChart
articles.description:
Hey, I'm Omar, and this time I wanted to bring you some good news about the latest release of LightningChart JS Trader 3.1.
LightningChart JS Trader is a high-precision chart suite for creating next-gen financial & trading applications.
In this release, we focused on adding quality-of-life improvements and bug fixes. Here are some of the changes:
Starting with version 3.1, LightningChart JS Trader is available for download from the public NPM registry. Previously, it was distributed via separate files sent by email. 
A valid license key (trial or purchased) is still required to use the library. Older versions will not be published on NPM. With this change, we are simplifying both updates and trial downloads.
You can now set the chart to use a transparent background, making it easier to match the application‚Äôs background. Here is an example of a chart with a transparent background. The colors come from the underlying div-elements:

The Mountain chart type can now be colored using a gradient fill. The coloring is based on the current line color and the enableMountainGradient() method can be used to switch the gradient on and off.

Time range methods
HTML text rendering
Menu options
Clear everything method
Problem with the space bar not closing menus anymore when typing in the input fields
The menus work better now when the chart height is small
Color pickers now appear next to the color button instead of the top-left corner.
However, note that Firefox browser has still some issues with this. Furthermore, the default color in the color pickers now matches the current color in all cases.
We also improved the accuracy of the data cursor The Zoomband chart height is now based on the main chart‚Äôs height, allowing it to scale better.
Access the latest version with a 30-day free trial. Or read the official release note.
Written by:
Send me your questions via LinkedIn
articles.title: LightningChart JS Trader v.3.1 has been released!
